summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a FOIA request related to Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence discusses the potential release of a one-page attorney visit room inventory log from the Bureau of Prisons, which contains inmate names but not that of Tartaglione. The team is checking for clearance before release.

persons.name: Jason Swergold
persons.context: Email sender from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), discussing the release of an Epstein-related FOIA document.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: Email recipient from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), involved in the FOIA review process for Epstein documents.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating on a FOIA matter related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FOIA Document Review for Release
events.description: Internal email discussion about releasing a one-page attorney visit room inventory log related to Jeffrey Epstein under FOIA, with privacy redactions.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from January 14, 2021, regarding a FOIA request related to Jeffrey Epstein.
It references a one-page attorney visit room inventory log from the Bureau of Prisons that contains inmate names and was previously withheld.
The 'Noel team' has determined the log can now be released with privacy redactions.
The document confirms that the name 'Tartaglione' is not on the inventory log, alleviating concerns about his privacy in the release.
The correspondence shows ongoing FOIA processing and internal review procedures within the U.S. Attorney's Office post-Epstein's death.
